title: Which Love Island 2019 couples are still together as Maura and Curtis go official?
text:

This series of Love Island is shaping up to be even worse than 2018's in terms of everlasting romance - after not one but THREE different couples called it quits less than six weeks after leaving the villa.

Chris Taylor and Harley Brash split in record time for the show - they're matched by Samira Mighty and Frankie Foster, who broke up on the same day in 2018.

The couple claimed they were too busy to pursue their romance and "haven't had enough quality time" with each other since leaving the villa.

Winners Greg O'Shea and Amber Gill also split just five weeks after taking home their £50,000 cash prize.

He dumped her by text when the question of their long distance reared its head, but refused to apologise for his brutal delivery method.

But there's a silver lining to the reality cloud, and that is Curtis Pritchard and Maura Higgins.

The pair have finally announced they're officially boyfriend and girlfriend some three months after the show wrapped, with Curtis insisting he wanted to make sure their relationship could survive on the outside.

So which couples are still going strong? Let's take a look.

Tommy Fury and Molly-Mae Hague

Molly-Mae and Tommy Fury are still going strong in the months after coming second place - but their relationship hasn't been smooth sailing.

Molly has struggled with online trolls since she came out of the villa and has had to face accusations that she was faking feelings for Tommy to win the show's 50K reward.

There are also rumours that other Love Island cast members banned the couple from coming to Ibiza to celebrate Danny Williams' birthday.

Curtis Pritchard and Maura Higgins

(Image: Curtis Pritchard/Instagram)

Dancer Curtis and Irish beauty Maura came fourth in the reality show, and have been busy ever since.

Curtis jetted out to Ireland straight after the show so the two could spend some quality time together.

Curtis recently joined the team on The Greatest Dancer, and even photobombed Cheryl on set.

Maura, meanwhile, has drawn the adoration of Hollywood stars Lena Dunham and Amy Schumer.

The pair announced they were boyfriend and girlfriend in October, having taken their time to make their relationship official.

"He asked and I said yes obviously," Maura told OK! of the moment Curtis popped the question.

"He took me away for a weekend break, and he asked me out over dinner in London the next day."

Curtis explained why it took him so long, saying: "I want something that's going to last forever. There's no point in rushing things. We've only known each other a short amount of time."

Ovie Soko and India Reynolds

(Image: Beretta/Sims/REX)

India was open about her affections for Ovie from the moment she set foot in the villa.

Both their dates went off without a hitch, and they found themselves placing third in the final.

During Love Island: The Reunion, India's friends told of how Ovie had "restored their faith in men".

The couple revealed that they've met each other's families, and even went on a double date with champions Amber and Greg.

However, they've been dogged by split rumours since going quiet on each other's social media.

Their last public appearance was in September at the TV Choice Awards, where the couple admitted they were taking the right steps.

Ovie confirmed that the pair are official, laughing: "Yeah, I'm saying yes," while India nodded in agreement.

It follows cheating claims in September, as India was forced to deny she had kissed her footballer ex Kieran Gibbs.

Anton Danyluk and Belle Hassan

Scottish hunk Anton revealed a fortnight after leaving the villa that he and Belle Hassan hadn't slept together and that they weren't official - preferring to take things slowly.

But with Belle in London and Anton in Scotland, it wasn't long before cracks started appearing.

Anton and Belle split on September 5 - with pals insisting he had never seen their romance as a real relationship .

But they were spotted back together on pal Anna Vakili's Instagram Story in October.

Greg O'Shea and Amber Gill

(Image: Internet Unknown)

The rugby player and the beautician were fan favourites as soon as they got together.

Fans were overjoyed to seem them crowned champs of the villa, and the couple seemed to be going from strength to strength.

But on September 6 - less than 24 hours after Belle and Anton's news - reports confirmed the winners had broken up after just five weeks of dating.

The pair had admitted their long distance was hard work, but pals claimed Greg hadn't been to London to visit Amber once, leaving her to do all the legwork.

It was also claimed he dumped her by text, leaving her feeling 'used' and 'devastated'.
description: After Amber Gill and Greg O'Shea called it quits just five weeks in, which couples are still together from Love Island 2019?
